Morphology: Cocci, spherical, singly in pairs or short chains of 3-4 cells
Optimal Media Composition (per 100ml): Tryptic digest of casein 1.5 g, Soy peptone 1.5 g, Sodium chloride 0.5 g, Dipotassium phosphate 0.25 g, Glucose 0.25 g, Agar 1.5 g
Differential Media Composition: Beef extract 0.1 g, Peptone 1.0 g, Sodium chloride 7.5 g, Mannitol 1.0 g, Phenol red 0.025 g, Agar 1.5 g
Biochemical Test: Catalase positive, Coagulase positive, Oxidase negative, Mannitol fermentation positive, Methyl red positive, Voges Proskauer positive
Origin/Source: Normal skin flora, mucous membranes, causes nosocomial infections

Morphology: Rod-shaped, straight, 0.4 to 0.7 micrometers in diameter
Optimal Media Composition (per 100ml): Tryptone 1.0 g, Yeast extract 0.5 g, Sodium chloride 0.5 g, Agar 1.0 g
Differential Media Composition: Peptone 1.7 g, Lactose 1.0 g, Sodium chloride 0.5 g, Phenol red 0.03 g, Bile salts 0.15 g, Agar 1.5 g
Biochemical Test: Oxidase negative, Methyl red positive, Voges Proskauer negative, Indole positive, Nitrate reduction positive
Origin/Source: Normal intestinal flora, causes urinary tract infections, gastroenteritis

Morphology: Cocci, spherical or oval, 0.5 to 1 micrometer in diameter, arranged in chains
Optimal Media: Blood Agar supplemented with 5 percent sheep blood
Optimal Media Composition (per 100ml): Peptone 1.0 g, Meat extract 0.3 g, Sodium chloride 0.5 g, Agar 1.5 g, Defibrinated sheep blood 5.0 ml
Differential Media: Blood Agar with bacitracin sensitivity test
Differential Media Composition: Peptone 1.0 g, Meat extract 0.3 g, Sodium chloride 0.5 g, Agar 1.5 g, Defibrinated sheep blood 5.0 ml, Bacitracin disc
Biochemical Test: Catalase negative, Oxidase negative, Beta hemolysis on blood agar, Bacitracin sensitive, Pyrrolidonyl arylamidase negative
Origin/Source: Normal respiratory tract, causes pharyngitis, rheumatic fever, acute poststreptococcal glomerulonephritis
Optimal Growth Aerobic Conditions: Facultative anaerobe, 5 to 10 percent carbon dioxide enhances hemolysis

Morphology: Cocci, lanceolate-shaped diplococci, 0.5 to 1.25 micrometers in diameter
Optimal Media: Blood Agar supplemented with 5 percent sheep blood
Optimal Media Composition (per 100ml): Peptone 1.0 g, Meat extract 0.3 g, Sodium chloride 0.5 g, Agar 1.5 g, Defibrinated sheep blood 5.0 ml
Differential Media Composition: Peptone 10 g, Meat Extract 3 g, Agar 15 g, Sodium Chloride 5 g, Distilled Water 100 ml, 5% Sheep Blood 10 ml, Optochin disc, Bile disc
Biochemical Test: Catalase negative, Oxidase negative, Alpha hemolysis on blood agar, Optochin sensitive, Bile soluble positive
Origin/Source: Normal nasopharyngeal flora, causes pneumonia, meningitis, bacteremia
Optimal Growth Aerobic Conditions: Facultative anaerobe, 5 percent carbon dioxide required

Morphology: Rod-shaped, straight, 0.5 to 0.8 micrometers in diameter, 1.5 to 3 micrometers in length
Optimal Media Composition (per 100ml): Tryptone 1.0 g, Yeast extract 0.5 g, Sodium chloride 0.5 g, Agar 1.5 g
Differential Media Composition: Protein hydrolysate 2.0 g, Magnesium chloride 0.14 g, Potassium sulfate 0.1 g, Irgasan 0.004 g, Agar 1.5 g
Biochemical Test: Oxidase positive, Catalase positive, Non-fermenting gram negative rod, Arginine dihydrolase positive, Produces pyocyanin pigment
Origin/Source: Environmental bacterium, opportunistic pathogen, causes wound infections, respiratory tract infections in hospitalized patients

Morphology: Rod-shaped, plump, 0.3 to 0.5 micrometers in diameter, 0.6 to 6 micrometers in length
Optimal Media Composition (per 100ml): Peptone 1.7 g, Lactose 1.0 g, Sodium chloride 0.5 g, Phenol red 0.03 g, Bile salts 0.15 g, Agar 1.5 g
Differential Media Composition: Peptone 1.0 g, Yeast extract 0.5 g, Sodium chloride 0.5 g, Bile salts 0.15 g, Agar 1.5 g
Biochemical Test: Oxidase negative, Methyl red negative, Voges Proskauer positive, Indole negative, Citrate positive, Urease positive
Origin/Source: Normal gastrointestinal flora, environmental bacterium, causes nosocomial infections, pneumonia

Morphology: Rod-shaped, coccobacillus, pleomorphic, 0.3 to 0.5 micrometers in diameter
Optimal Media: Chocolate Agar supplemented with hemin and NAD
Optimal Media Composition (per 100ml): Peptone 1.5 g, Sodium chloride 0.5 g, Cornstarch 0.1 g, Dipotassium phosphate 0.4 g, Monopotassium phosphate 0.1 g, Hemin solution 0.01 g, Nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide (NAD) 0.0005 g, Agar 1.0 g
Differential Media Composition: Peptone 1.5 g, Sodium chloride 0.5 g, Cornstarch 0.1 g, Dipotassium phosphate 0.4 g, Monopotassium phosphate 0.1 g, Hemoglobin solution (2%) 2.0 ml, Bacitracin 0.01 g, Agar 1.0 g
Biochemical Test: Oxidase positive, Catalase positive, Gram negative coccobacillus, Indole positive or negative depending on biotype, Urease negative
Origin/Source: Normal nasopharyngeal flora, causes meningitis, epiglottitis, otitis media, respiratory infections

Morphology: Cocci, kidney-shaped or reniform, 0.6 to 1 micrometer in diameter, arranged in pairs
Optimal Media Composition (per 100ml): GC base 3.6 g, Hemoglobin 1.0 g, Supplement 1.0 ml, Vancomycin 0.001 g, Colistin 0.00008 g, Nystatin 0.0001 g, Amphotericin B 0.0001 g, Agar 1.5 g

Origin/Source: Urogenital tract, causes gonorrhea, urethritis, cervicitis
Optimal Growth Aerobic Conditions: Microaerophile, 5 to 10 percent carbon dioxide required

Morphology: Cocci, kidney-shaped or reniform, 0.6 to 1 micrometer in diameter, arranged in pairs
Optimal Media Composition (per 100ml): GC base 3.6 g, Hemoglobin 1.0 g, Supplement 1.0 ml, Vancomycin 0.001 g, Colistin 0.00008 g, Nystatin 0.0001 g, Amphotericin B 0.0001 g, Agar 1.5 g
Differential Media Composition: GC base 3.6 g, Hemoglobin 1.0 g, Supplement 1.0 ml, Vancomycin 0.001 g, Colistin 0.00008 g, Nystatin 0.0001 g, Agar 1.5 g
Biochemical Test: Oxidase positive, Catalase positive, Gram negative diplococcus, Glucose fermentation positive, Maltose fermentation positive
Origin/Source: Nasopharyngeal flora, causes meningitis, bacteremia, sepsis
Optimal Growth Aerobic Conditions: Microaerophile, 5 to 10 percent carbon dioxide required

Morphology: Cocci, spherical or ovoid, 0.6 to 1 micrometer in diameter, in pairs or short chains
Optimal Media Composition (per 100ml): Peptone 1.0 g, Meat extract 0.3 g, Sodium chloride 0.5 g, Agar 1.5 g, Defibrinated sheep blood 5.0 ml
Differential Media Composition: Beef extract 0.5 g, Peptone 0.5 g, Sodium chloride 0.5 g, Esculin 0.1 g, Ferric citrate 0.05 g, Agar 1.5 g

Morphology: Cocci, spherical or ovoid, 0.6 to 1 micrometer in diameter, in pairs or short chains
Optimal Media Composition (per 100ml): Peptone 1.0 g, Meat extract 0.3 g, Sodium chloride 0.5 g, Agar 1.5 g, Defibrinated sheep blood 5.0 ml
Differential Media Composition: Beef extract 0.5 g, Peptone 0.5 g, Sodium chloride 0.5 g, Esculin 0.1 g, Ferric citrate 0.05 g, Agar 1.5 g
Biochemical Test: Catalase negative, Bile esculin positive, Non-hemolytic or alpha-hemolytic on blood agar, Growth in 6.5 percent sodium chloride, Leucine aminopeptidase positive
Origin/Source: Normal gastrointestinal flora, less common in urogenital tract than E. faecalis, causes nosocomial infections

Differential Media Composition: Beef extract 0.5 g, Peptone 0.5 g, Lactose 1.0 g, Sodium chloride 0.5 g, Sodium thiosulfate 0.1 g, Ferric citrate 0.03 g, Agar 1.5 g
Biochemical Test: Oxidase negative, Methyl red positive, Voges Proskauer negative, Indole negative, Citrate positive, Hydrogen sulfide positive

Morphology: Rod-shaped, straight, typically non-motile or slowly motile, 0.3 to 0.7 micrometers in diameter
Optimal Media Composition (per 100ml): Beef extract 0.5 g, Peptone 0.5 g, Lactose 1.0 g, Sodium chloride 0.5 g, Sodium thiosulfate 0.1 g, Ferric citrate 0.03 g, Agar 1.5 g
Differential Media Composition: Beef extract 0.5 g, Peptone 0.5 g, Lactose 1.0 g, Sodium chloride 0.5 g, Sodium thiosulfate 0.1 g, Ferric citrate 0.03 g, Agar 1.5 g
Biochemical Test: Oxidase negative, Methyl red positive, Voges Proskauer negative, Indole negative, Citrate negative, Hydrogen sulfide negative

Differential Media Composition: Peptone 2.3 g, Corn starch 0.5 g, Sodium chloride 0.5 g, Triphenyltetrazolium chloride 0.004 g, Agar 1.5 g

Differential Media Composition: Peptone 1.5 g, Sodium chloride 0.5 g, Cornstarch 0.1 g, Dipotassium phosphate 0.4 g, Monopotassium phosphate 0.1 g, Hemin solution 0.01 g, Nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide (NAD) 0.0005 g, Agar 1.0 g

Optimal Media Composition (per 100ml): Peptone 1.0 g, Yeast extract 0.5 g, Sodium thiosulfate 0.1 g, Sodium citrate 0.1 g, Bile salts 0.3 g, Sucrose 1.0 g, Agar 1.5 g

Differential Media Composition: PPLO broth 1.0 g, Yeast extract 0.5 g, Horse serum 1.0 ml, Methylene blue 0.0001 g, Agar 1.5 g
Biochemical Test: No cell wall so gram staining not reliable, Forms characteristic fried egg colonies, Reduces methylene blue, Non-motile

Differential Media Composition: Peptone 10 g, Meat Extract 3 g, Agar 15 g, Sodium Chloride 5 g, Distilled Water 100 ml, 5% Sheep Blood 10 ml

Morphology: Rod-shaped, pleomorphic, short, 0.5 to 0.8 micrometers in diameter

Optimal Media Composition (per 100ml): Brain heart infusion 1.0 g, Hemin 0.0005 g, Menadione 0.00005 g, Agar 1.5 g
Differential Media Composition: Peptone 10 g, Meat Extract 3 g, Agar 15 g, Sodium Chloride 5 g, Distilled Water 100 ml, 5% Sheep Blood 10 ml

Differential Media Composition: Peptone 10 g, Meat Extract 3 g, Agar 15 g, Sodium Chloride 5 g, Distilled Water 100 ml, 5% Sheep Blood 10 ml

Differential Media Composition: Peptone 10 g, Meat Extract 3 g, Agar 15 g, Sodium Chloride 5 g, Distilled Water 100 ml, 5% Sheep Blood 10 ml
